Overview

HackerRank is excited to introduce a new share feature that allows for more convenient sharing. Users are now able to click share within their questions and tests to select additional users, teams, or even the entire company to share with.

New Sharing Option for Questions

As users click to share a question, as seen in the screenshot below, they will be able to select specific people to share the question with.

Share Question

When sharing, users will also be able to select a level of access when sharing. Currently, questions are shared automatically with all teams the owner is part of. The owner is not able to share their questions outside of their teams.

Question Sharing FAQs

  • Will anyone lose access to questions they already have access to when this feature is released?
    • No, the automated team-based sharing system will still be in place. This feature will allow users to share with others outside of their team.
  • Can I disable the automated team based shared?
    • Not currently. We are working on an option to disable automated team-based sharing. 
  • Who can share a question?
    • The owner, company admins, or other users/teams with editor access.
  • What does transferring ownership do?
    • If you transfer ownership to another user, the original owner will become an editor of the question, and the new owner will take control of the question. The current owner of a question will always have full access to the question. While automated team sharing is active, this will modify which teams have access to the question by default. You can not remove access from teams that automatically have access to the question.
  • Can I remove access from someone I shared with?
    • Yes, within the sharing menu, if you click on a user or team you shared with, you will see an option to remove them.

Improved Explicit Sharing On Tests

HackerRank is building a new explicit sharing user experience with tests, making it easy to modify access and providing complete visibility into who has access. This system will replace the existing sharing system.

When users click to share a test, they will now be able to elect specific people and levels of permissions.

Test Sharing FAQs 

  • What happens to the old sharing system on tests outside of automated team-based sharing?
    • Read Only - Clean transition to Viewer 
    • Read & Modify Test - Transition to Viewer.
    • Read & Edit Candidate Reports - Clean transition to Evaluator
    • Read, Modify Test, and Edit Candidate Reports - Clean transition to Editor
  • Will anyone lose access to tests they already have access to when this feature is released?
    • No, the automated team-based sharing system will still be in place. This feature will allow users to share with others outside of their team.
  • Can I disable the automated team based shared?
    • Not currently. HackerRank is working on an option to disable automated team-based sharing. When this feature is released and enabled for a company, we will migrate all existing access to questions to the new sharing system and newly created questions will only be accessible to the owner and company admins unless they share with others.
  • Who can share a test?
    • The owner, company admins, or other users/teams with editor access.
  • What does transferring ownership do?
    • If you transfer ownership to another user, the original owner will become an editor of the question, and the new owner will take control of the question. The current owner of a question will always have full access to the question. While automated team sharing is active, this will modify which teams have access to the question by default. You can not remove access from teams that automatically have access to the question.
  • Can I remove access from someone I shared with?
    • Yes, within the sharing menu, if you click on a user or team you shared with, you will see an option to remove them.
